article.description: Rich DeVos has something to sell, and his product looked quite attractive Monday night.
article.headline: Mavs score just 9 third-quarter points in Magic rout
article.linkText: Magic beneficiaries of Mavs' offensive breakdown
article.story:
ORLANDO, Fla. (AP) -- Don Nelson could tell the Dallas Mavericks were close to ending up on the wrong end of a blowout.
McGrady

The Mavericks scored a season-low nine points in the third quarter and had their three-game winning streak snapped in a 113-87 loss to the Orlando Magic on Monday night. "Thank goodness it only counts as one loss," Nelson said. "It wasn't a very good effort on our part, but we've dodged about three or four bullets in the last seven or eight games, so you could kind of see this coming. Maybe it was good it happened all at once." Tracy McGrady had 26 points and eight rebounds in three quarters for the Magic. Reserve Troy Hudson scored 16 of his 21 points in the second quarter, and Horace Grant added 16. Juwan Howard had 26 points and eight rebounds to lead Dallas, while Wang Zhizhi tied a career high with 13 points. Dirk Nowitzki and Steve Nash, who entered the game averaging a combined 44 points, each scored just four and shot a collective 3-for-18. "The thing we wanted to take away from Nowitzki was his penetration, his speed that he has, that advantage over all the forwards," Orlando coach Doc Rivers said. "We really wanted to attack (Nash) off the dribble on offense because we thought we had a chance to get him in foul trouble. The Magic put the game away with a 24-5 run at the start of the second half. When McGrady hit two free throws with 4:21 left in the period, and Darrell Armstrong added another following a technical foul on Tim Hardaway, Orlando led 84-59. Mike Miller had 11 of his 15 points in the third period. He began the quarter with a 3-pointer and ended it with an emphatic dunk for a 94-63 lead. The Mavericks, meanwhile, missed 20 of 23 shots in the period. It was Orlando's franchise best for an opponent's scoring in the third quarter. "The deserve some credit, but you play so many games in the this league that sometimes you don't have it," said Nash, who missed all four of his shots in the quarter. "In the second half, we were just so flat. We had no legs and we started missing everything. It was just one of those nights." Orlando took a 60-54 halftime lead behind its best shooting quarter of the season. The Magic shot 71 percent (10-of-14) and scored 36 points. Hudson shot 4-of-5, including 2-for-3 from 3-point range, and made all six free throws. "Offensively, we were great, we really were," Rivers said. "I was just happy because we moved on offense, we set picks on offense, we played the game on offense." Earlier Monday, Orlando Magic officials formally announced that the franchise is for sale. The Magic, who haven't convinced local officials of the need for a new arena, claim they are losing about $10 million a year. Game notes
Grant is averaging 14.8 points and shooting 64 percent in his last six games, including five as the starting center. ... Before the game, the Mavericks activated forward Donnell Harvey from the injured list and placed point guard Charlie Bell on the list. ... Rivers said center Patrick Ewing could come off the injured list by the weekend. Ewing has missed the last five games with tendinitis in his right Achilles' and calf. ... Former Orlando coach Richie Adubato was in attendance.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.
